intro: Ceropegia congestiflora, commonly known as the clustered ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered together, giving it its common name. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Ceropegia congestiflora is popular as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
